com.quest.glue.api.services
Interface ICMPService

All Superinterfaces:
Service
public interface ICMPService
extends Service

Foglight Service interface to provide hosts' availability verification by sending ICMP ECHO requests. This service makes use of an external native application to open raw sockets and issue the ECHO requests. On most platforms the native application must be run with elevated privileges (root) to access the raw sockets.

FglAM provides support for granting elevated privileges through the use of secure loaders, with /usr/bin/sudo being the most secure. If the native application cannot be launched then attempts at accessing this service will result in a ServiceFactory.ServiceNotAvailableException to be thrown.

Method Detail

ping

java.util.Collection<java.net.InetAddress> ping(java.util.Collection<java.net.InetAddress> targets,
                                                ICMPReplyListener listener,
                                                long timeout)
                                                throws java.io.IOException,
                                                       java.lang.InterruptedException
Group check whether that targets are reachable by sending ICMP ECHO request. A collection of all the InetAddresses that successfully responded to pings will be returned once this method completes. If an address is not returned then it either timed out and did not respond to the ECHO request or responded with an error code.

An ICMPReplyListener can be provided that will receive more detailed notifications such as the length of time required for the ping to complete or reasons for why the ping failed.

The timeout value, in milliseconds, indicates the maximum amount of time the try should take. If the operation times out before getting an answer, the host is deemed unreachable. Zero or a negative timeout value will result in an IllegalArgumentException being thrown.

Parameters:
targets - The collection of addresses to send pings
listener - An optional listener that receives detailed information about each ping request
timeout - The time, in milliseconds, before the call aborts
Returns:
A collection of target addresses that successfully responded to the ICMP ECHO request
Throws:
java.io.IOException - If network error occurs
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If timeout is zero or negative
java.lang.InterruptedException - The ping request was interrupted before all the responses arrived

ping

java.util.Collection<java.net.InetAddress> ping(java.util.Collection<java.net.InetAddress> targets,
                                                ICMPReplyListener listener,
                                                long timeout,
                                                long delay)
                                                throws java.io.IOException,
                                                       java.lang.InterruptedException
Group check whether that targets are reachable by sending ICMP ECHO request. A collection of all the InetAddresses that successfully responded to the ping will be returned once this method completes. If an address is not returned then it either timed out and did not respond to the ECHO request or responded with an error code.

An ICMPReplyListener can be provided that will receive more detailed notifications such as the length of time required for the ping to complete or reasons for why the ping failed.

The timeout value, in milliseconds, indicates the maximum amount of time the try should take. If, for a particular ping, the operation times out before getting an answer, the corresponding host is deemed unreachable. Zero or a negative timeout value will result in an IllegalArgumentException being thrown.

The delay value, in milliseconds (default 10ms), indicates the time between ICMP ECHO requests to avoid flooding the network. Using an extremely small delay value may result in ICMP ECHO requests being discarded by the network interface or by network firewalls / gateways.

Parameters:
targets - The collection of addresses to send pings
listener - An optional listener that receives detailed information about each ping request
timeout - The time, in milliseconds, before the call aborts
delay - The time, in milliseconds, to wait between consecutive ping requests
Returns:
A collection of target addresses that successfully responded to the ICMP ECHO request
Throws:
java.io.IOException - If network error occurs
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If timeout is zero or negative
java.lang.InterruptedException - The ping request was interrupted before all the responses arrived

ping

boolean ping(java.net.InetAddress target,
             int timeout)
             throws java.io.IOException,
                    java.lang.InterruptedException
Convenience method used to ping a single address, returning true or false depending on whether the host successfully responded to the PING request or not.

The timeout value, in milliseconds, indicates the maximum amount of time the try should take. If the operation times out before getting an answer, the host is deemed unreachable. Zero or a negative timeout value will result in an IllegalArgumentException being thrown.

Parameters:
target - The address to ping
timeout - The time, in milliseconds, before the call aborts
Returns:
True if the host at address responded successfully to the ping
Throws:
java.io.IOException - If network error occurs
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If timeout is zero or negative
java.lang.InterruptedException - The ping request was interrupted before all the responses arrived
